intro: Aureliana anonacea, commonly known as the golden star tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, with a glossy green surface. The fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
